awd_titl_txt: Historical Perspectives on American Women and Technological Change
awd_abstract_narration: Among the central concerns of this project are such questions as: How is feminine technology  distinctive?  What do these distinctions tell us about technology and about women?  How have  Americans' cultural perceptions of gender differences shaped and been shaped by technological  change?  To explore such questions this project will examine seven `feminine` technologies,  meaning technologies associated with women either by virtue of biological difference or by  virtue of sex role prescription (especially through the division of labor).  Unlike other studies of  women and technology that focus on exceptional women using technologies that are  predominantly masculine in character, this project will ask what sorts of technological  knowledge common American women have historically possessed, how they have used that  knowledge, and why women's technological knowledge has been largely undervalued.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Social and Economic Sciences
